title.narrative: 3.2. MONITOR INCLUSIVE PRIMARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2021, the national, regional and priority local governments will have built their capacities to monitor the management of inclusive, quality and relevant primary-education policies for indigenous, rural and peri-urban children., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, children exposed to concerns related to gender, ethnicity, area of residence, living conditions or differences in skills will live in safe environments and have full access to relevant and quality registration, health, nutrition, care, education, water, sanitation and hygiene services that promote their full development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the national, regional and priority local governments will have built their capacities to monitor the management ofinclusive, quality and relevant primary-education policies for indigenous, rural and peri-urban children.

description.narrative: In a context marked by two years of school closure, UNICEF implemented an intensive advocacy plan and supported initiatives to promote the safe reopening of schools. UNICEF contributed to improve guidelines on Intercultural Bilingual Education (IBE) and Rural Education Policies, for distance learning and address the educational gaps of vulnerable populations reaching 102,600 students, in five indigenous languages. In inclusive education, UNICEF supported the consolidation of a new policy framework and developed capacities in key Ministry of Education (MoE) personnel. UNICEF launched the ECW programme and continues to support the inclusion of 120,088 Venezuelan migrants’ children in the education system. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2021

title.narrative: Level of progress in the implementation of the policy and national plan of IBE.(48330)

target.value: 2021:Level 4 (Monitoring of policy and plan disseminated and incorporated into annual management guidelines such as the pre-school directive and other equivalents)

actual.value: 2021:Level 3 The IBE policy’s monitoring system and indicators matrix is included in MINEDU’s management structure. This system generated national and regional progress reviews based on selected indicators until March 2020. It has not been used often during th

title.narrative: The country has systems of regular (annual) monitoring of progress in Intercultural Bilingual Education, Rural Education, and Inclusive Education; whose results are publicly disseminated.(48331)

baseline.value: Score 1 Annual information produced by Ministry of Education (MINEDU) for at least 2 of the 3 identified areas (Intercultural Bilingual Education, Rural Education and Inclusive Education)

target.value: 2021:Score 5 Annual information produced by Ministry of Education (MINEDU) includes monitoring of equity, budget and specific plans for the 3 identified areas; And is used for educational policy decision making

actual.value: 2021:Score 4 In the case of IBE, the policy monitoring system allows national and regional annual reports. However, there have been no updates to these reports in rural education or children with disabilities due to the pandemic. It should be noted that MINEDU

title.narrative: Degree of development of undergraduate teacher training programmes in IBE and pre-school level, to scattered and rural areas.(48333)

baseline.value: Score 1 There are training programs in intercultural bilingual education for preschool or primary, specifically aimed at improving performance in rural or scattered areas of intervention regions.

target.value: 2021:Score 3 There are training programs in intercultural bilingual education for preschool and primary, specifically aimed at improving performance in rural and scattered areas of intervention regions.

actual.value: 2021:Score 2: The new curriculum for teacher training in IBE was supported by UNICEF and approved in 2019 for kindergarten and primary levels. This curriculum has not been translated into new UNICEF programs due to the pandemic. Only in Ucayali, UNICEF support
